author: sky.cactus
content: <@!291925846556540928> I just saw the EIP that came out of this discussion, and it feels very out of place in the EIPs repository.  It has basically nothing to do with the execution layer (no changes related to the execution layer at least).  It is all consensus layer changes/APIs and how they communicate the current execution layer state.  Am I missing something?  Is there something that *actually* impacts the execution layer in here?  cc <@!554799849288105986>

author: sky.cactus
content: No EIP yet, it is still in PR.  Here is the PR though: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/4881

author: timbeiko
content: FWIW, I think it makes sense to have these in EIPs. <@!301186049323958275> was trying to avoid this can of worms pre-merge, but would it be helpful to have a discussion about how we adapt the repo in a post-merge context?
